fields.summary: Movies Sample app launches and sits on splash with "appc run", runs as expected with "ti build"

fields.description:
Environment:
{code}
Operating System
  Name                        = Mac OS X
  Version                     = 10.10.3
  Architecture                = 64bit
  # CPUs                      = 8
  Memory                      = 17179869184
Node.js
  Node.js Version             = 0.10.38
  npm Version                 = 1.4.28
Titanium CLI
  CLI Version                 = 3.4.2
Titanium SDK
  SDK Version                 = 3.5.1.GA
  SDK Path                    = /Volumes/Data/Users/sebastian/Library/Application Support/Titanium/mobilesdk/osx/3.5.1.GA
  Target Platform             = iphone
{code}

Building on device works, but starting the app fails with the following message:
Failure loading the application assets

Reproducible for me also with 4.0.0.Beta2

Build with Titanium Studio 3.4.1.201410281727 works normal as expected
fields.summary: Studio: Build on device works, but app crashes on app start

comments.body: Sebastian - Did you import this app with CLI 4.0.0 or Studio before building it with 4.0.0 SDK? Please share the build command that you used to build this app.

With Appcelerator Studio, build: 4.0.0.201504161435 and 

sebastian-MacBook-Pro:sebastian sebastian$ appc -V
0.2.247

it works on simulator and device

Issue can be closed
